definition: to enlighten/to civilize/to indoctrinate/to train (an animal)
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: But we're civilizing them! he assured me.
sentences.chinese: 但這是我們在教化他們，他還狂妄的向我解釋說。

sentences.english: Only the mighty God has the power on this dark land to lighten it.
sentences.chinese: 只有萬能的上帝纔有能力在這個愚昧的國土上教化它。

sentences.english: Widow Douglas is trying to civilize me?and I won't stand for that.
sentences.chinese: 道格拉斯寡婦想要教化我，那我可受不了。

sentences.english: Traditionally, prose lays emphasis on the description of the objective world and didactical instructions.
sentences.chinese: 傳統散文重在對客觀世界的描摹和對讀者的“教化”。

sentences.english: So Confucian Philosophy is named Philosophy of Humanization.
sentences.chinese: 儒家的哲學，可以名之爲“教化的哲學”。

sentences.english: Esthetic reception is of some self-educated function in the process of building a harmonious society.
sentences.chinese: 審美接受在建設和諧社會中具有自我教化功能。

sentences.english: And the humanity theory of either goodness or wickedness emphasized the necessity of humanizing populace by sage.
sentences.chinese: 同時可善可惡的人性論強調了聖人教化民衆的必要性。

sentences.english: Many a man has been civilized by his wife.
sentences.chinese: 許多男人都是被他們的妻子教化的。

sentences.english: Citizens in the city's civil  buildings are all civilized.
sentences.chinese: 城市民用建築內的市民全都得到教化。

sentences.english: YUAN Zhen gave definition of erotic poetry.
sentences.chinese: 元稹自敘“豔詩”定義，以“幹教化”相標榜。

sentences.english: Schools will help to civilize the wild tribes there.
sentences.chinese: 學校將會幫忙教化那裏的野蠻部落。

sentences.english: Those facilities are intended to civilize people.
sentences.chinese: 那些設施的目的在於教化民衆。

sentences.english: They tried to civilize the natives.
The third part focuses on Chen's enlightenment and practice of charity.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分，主要介紹陳龍正的教化理念與實踐。

sentences.english: Commendation for filial piety is very important to the social education in Tang and Song periods.
sentences.chinese: 旌表孝悌是唐宋兩代社會教化的重要方面。
對你來說體力勞動最具教化力。

definition: Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
(Confucianism) rites and music (the means of regulating society)
Jente township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
Confucian thoughts/the thinking of the Confucian school
ignorant masses/to keep the people in ignorance
doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
church and state/government and education/political education
